programme.title: Remembering Ruth Becker Blanchard Part 1
programme.desc: In this episode, Ken Marschall gives us a compelling look back at Titanic’s last night through the eyes of survivor Ruth Becker Blanchard.

programme.title: What did Marine Superintendent James McGiffin Know?
programme.desc: Why was White Star’s Marine Superintendent at Queenstown never called to give evidence to the British inquiry? After all, he was one of the last White Star representatives to step off Titanic before she sailed. Is this evidence that the inquiry was...

programme.title: Lightoller and Dunkirk
programme.desc: It turns out Titanic was only Act I for Charles Lightoller. Twenty-eight years after Titanic, he was at the helm of his own boat navigating through enemy fire while rescuing British troops from Dunkirk. He was a true British hero!

programme.title: Should Titanic Have Turned into the Iceberg?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson takes on the popular controversy that instead of trying to avoid the iceberg, maybe Titanic should have just turned directly into it? Could this have really saved Titanic?

programme.title: Fixing The Wireless
programme.desc: If Jack Phillips had followed the rules, the wireless set would have still been broken the night the Titanic hit the iceberg and the Carpathia may never have received the distress call in time. Instead, Jack took initiative and fixed it himself and...

programme.title: Titanic’s Pumps
programme.desc: Titanic’s engineers have always been an enduring story as they struggled with the pumps downstairs trying to keep them going to the very end. Was there ever any hope in their heroism?

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 1
programme.desc: Shipwreck explorer, Richie Kohler takes us without a submersible to the warm blue waters of the Aegean Sea and the remarkably preserved HMHS Britannic. Kohler reveals what it’s like to swim freely through the passageways of one of the largest...

programme.title: Did the Lights Stay On?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson introduces an eyewitness account who says that the lights stayed on in the aft part of Titanic after she broke! Parks also explains how this could have happened.

programme.title: How the Wreck Has Changed
programme.desc: Titanic Channel host and famed Titanic Explorer P.H. Nargeolet takes us back down to the wreck for a look at Titanic’s changing conditions and deterioration.

programme.title: Five Scratches in the Hull
programme.desc: The prevailing theory has always been that Titanic sideswiped the iceberg creating a 300 ft gash along her side. Famed Titanic Explorer, P.H. Nargeolet, discovered five scratches down her side.

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: Wrought Iron Gates on D Deck
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Titanic's First-Class Lounge
programme.desc: What did you do in Titanic’s First Class Lounge? Well oddly enough you didn’t lounge, corsets and celluloid collars prevented that! Bill Sauder gives us a look at what went on inside Titanic’s magnificent lounge for the rich and famous.

programme.title: An Experience of A Lifetime Diving Titanic
programme.desc: He was the first school teacher to dive Titanic, not once - but twice. In this very candid account, Titanic channel host Charles Haas tells us how nerves almost kept him from going. In the end, his journey to his beloved Titanic proved to be an exciting...

programme.title: The Padded Room
programme.desc: Hidden away in Titanic’s isolation hospital was a 5x6 room padded completely from top to bottom with canvas cushions. White Star didn’t talk much about the room, but Bill Sauder will tell you how it was used.

programme.title: Mystery Stairs On Titanic
programme.desc: Titanic Channel host Bill Sauder tells us that like any great English house, Titanic had her quirks; including hallways that seem to go nowhere and staircases that served no purposes. What were they thinking? Sauder will explain!

programme.title: The Big Four
programme.desc: Celtic, Cedric, Baltic, and Adriatic proceeded the design of Olympic, Titanic, and Britannic. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside reveals why in many ways, they were perhaps the most successful quartet of ships ever built for North Atlantic service.

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: Wrought Iron Gates on D Deck
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Archibald Gracie’s Last Letter
programme.desc: Host Andrew Aldridge reveals a remarkable letter written by Archibald Gracie barely eight weeks before he died. It was written to fellow Carpathia passenger Louis Ogden, who was responsible for some of the iconic photographs taken of Titanic survivors...

programme.title: The Last Remaining Lifeboat
programme.desc: John White, from White Star Memories, takes us through the preservation of Nomadic’s last lifeboat. From her discovery in France to her Belfast restoration, White Star’s last remaining lifeboat carries on the legacy.

programme.title: The Coal Burning Fire Photo
programme.desc: At the center of the new coal burning fire documentary, is the photograph that seems to show a 60 ft black mark along the side of Titanic’s hull. Famed artist, Ken Marschall, gives us his view of the photograph and the black mark.

programme.title: Thomas Andrews’ Notes - Mark Chirnside
programme.desc: When Olympic made her maiden voyage in June 1911 from Southampton to New York, Thomas Andrews traveled onboard to observe and take notes on potential improvements for Titanic and other ships. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside reveals how the suggested...

programme.title: Maiden Voyage Handbill
programme.desc: Senan Molony shares a rare artifact of the RMS Titanic and the White Star Line, showing just how important the ship was to commerce over the Atlantic.

programme.title: Goodbye Old Man
programme.desc: These incredible words written by the most senior surviving officer of the Titanic, gives us a rare and historic glimpse of the final moments of the senior men that night. It may surprise you to hear just how calm these men really were.

programme.title: Titanic Movie Memorabilia
programme.desc: One of the most desired categories of collectibles for Titanic enthusiasts is the growing movie memorabilia market – From the Nazi German Titanic movie in 1943 to James Cameron’s 1997 blockbuster - it’s all out there.

programme.title: Titanic's Second Class Carnage
programme.desc: Senan Molony calls the second class, “the forgotten class.” The men suffered, “absolute carnage,” they didn’t have a chance! Senan gives us a sobering look at what it was like as a second-class passenger the night Titanic sank.

programme.title: What's in a Name?
programme.desc: Why was it so important for White Star to make sure Titanic was named RMS Titanic instead of just SS Titanic?

programme.title: Grand Teton Loop Eng
programme.desc: Grand Teton National Park is a stunning and iconic park in the US, known for its majestic Teton Range, beautiful lakes, and diverse wildlife. In July of 2022, Jeff and Audrée made a stop on their way back to Canada while on a road trip to Colorado, so that they could run a 38 mile / 62 km loop around the park, which mile for mile would be one of the most scenic and beautiful routes theyve ever run.

programme.title: Nendaz FWT Challenger 2025
programme.desc: This year, Nendaz Freeride returns to the FWT Challenger, the final stage of the legendary Freeride World Tour, confirming its place among the best freeride competitions. The faces of Mont-Gond offer athletes an infinite number of lines and ideal conditions in which to practice their art. Thats why it attracts so many international freeriders in search of thrills and spills.

programme.title: Crewing & Pacing the 2022 Hardrock 100
programme.desc: In July of 2022, Jeff and Audrée drove to Silverton, Colorado to join their friends at the Hardrock 100, a 102 mile race with over 33,000 of elevation gain in a remote region of the San Juan Mountains. Their friends Dana and Ken from Vancouver were running the race, and with their other friends Jackie and Jeff, Theyd be supporting them both and helping to crew Ken and to take turns pacing him through the final half of the race.

programme.title: Golden Trail World Series 2022 - Zegama (Eng)
programme.desc: "Zegama is Zegama” The Basque Fever. Only a few lucky runners have the opportunity to run through the Basque Country’s highest peaks and fall under the spectators’ charms who cheer them on at every step. A town with just over 1,500 inhabitants is transformed to become the trail running epicenter for a unique weekend.

programme.title: Golden Trail World Series 2023 Episode 1 Zegama
programme.desc: Golden trail series consist of trail running races where the best athletes in the world are competing. GTWS consist of 6 races + final. Races will be held in Zegama (Spain), Marathon du Mont Blanc (France), Dolomyths run (Italy), Sierre-Zinal (Switzerland), Pikes Peak ascent (Colorado USA), Mammoth 26k (California, USA) and grand final il Golfo dell’Isola trail race (Italy). First stop of GTWS is in Spain, in Basque country in a small village of Zegama. It is in the northern end of the Pyrenees and It has its own language and unique culture. The race is one of the most popular in the world because of the insane crowd. Fans of trail running come every year on the famous part of the race from Sancti Spiritu segment to the Aizkorri summit to support and cheer on the runners.

programme.title: Cardiff Half Marathon 2024
programme.desc: The Cardiff Half Marathon has grown into one of the largest and most exciting road races in the United Kingdom; and is truly a Race For Everyone. It is now one of Europe’s largest half marathons and is Wales’ largest mass participation and multi-charity fundraising event. The race is a member of the SuperHalfs, a global series of the world’s most prestigious half marathons including races in Lisbon, Prague, Berlin, Copenhagen, Cardiff and Valencia.

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show 2023 - Episode 5
programme.desc: We start our episode from Spain and a renowned Triathlon event in Portocolom, Mallorca. We then stay in Mallorca and we will now follow a cycling one. The 13th edition of the Mallorca 312 OK Mobility. We then leave Mallorca, but stay in Spain for another cycling event, the 13th edition of the Andalucia Bike Race. Then time to move to the new sport’s concept, that bridges the gap between traditional endurance and functional fitness and combines running with well-known gym exercises in a standardized format. Later on we follow the UltraSwim 33.3 event which has the iconic challenge of the English Channel as its inspiration and the event will test swimmers in the equivalent distance of 33.3km, spread over four days and six swims.

programme.title: Golden Trail Series - Chasing Dreams Season 2022 - Episode 1 Keep Dreaming (Eng)
programme.desc: A new season starts, teams from all around the globe are joining the circuit. For the first time in the Golden Trail Series, runners from Kenya will take on the mountains with hopes of being as fast as they are on the roads. The legendary Zegama is finally back as the opening race of the season, the show is guaranteed.

programme.title: Salerno Boat Show - 2021
programme.desc: Our Maria Elisa Altese takes you to Marina DArechi, a modern strategic port just a few miles from the Amalfi Coast. This is where the fifth edition of the Salerno Boat Show takes place, an appointment that over the years has become a reference point for boat enthusiasts in central and southern Italy.

programme.title: Yanmar Venmar Lido 32 - Sustainable Navigation
programme.desc: Follow Maurizio Bulleri testing the future of green mobility with the Venmar Lido 32, the latest generation Yanmar Diesel powered boat, powered by HVO, 100 organic Hydrotreated Vegetable Oil.

programme.title: Raymarine - YachtSense Ecosystem
programme.desc: Hop on the FIM Regina 470 to test Raymarine’s full optional onboard electronics.

programme.title: Esthec
programme.desc: Esthec is a company that produces coverings for the decks of all boats. Their innovative flooring is a sustainable and resistant material, suitable for the construction of bridges, decks, interiors and exteriors of yachts and for other types of boat.

programme.title: A new point of reference
programme.desc: Discover a yacht that is different from the ones in the same category and that offers an intense interaction with the sea. With its luxurious style and magnificent interior and exterior spaces, the Bluegame BGX 70 is destined to be a point of reference for other boats.

programme.title: Heesen Yachts Palm Beach International Boat Show 2024
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese presents Book Ends, the 50 meter superyacht by Heesen Yachts. The strengths of this vessel include exceptional performance, magnificent design and the shipyards cutting-edge innovation for eco-sustainable advancement.

programme.title: Riviera 78 Motoryacht – The jewel in the crown
programme.desc: Discover the Riviera 78 Motoryacht, the jewel in the crown at Riviera. Bill Hackett is on board to find out all about it.

programme.title: Absolute Navetta 75 - Perfection and harmony
programme.desc: Maurizio Bulleri is on board the gorgeous flagship model of the Absolute fleet, the Navetta 75. This yacht embodies the perfection and harmony that the shipyard has been researching.

programme.title: Pearl 72 - Flibs 2022
programme.desc: Worldwide premier of the Pearl 72, discover this incredible flybridge with many areas where to relax. Exceptional seakeeping, designed to follow the success of its sistership.

programme.title: Harris Sunliner 250 Sport - PBIBS 2023
programme.desc: Hop on board the Harris Sunliner 250 Sport, seen at the Palm Beach Boat Show 2023.

programme.title: Arcadia A96 - Interview with Francesco Ansalone
programme.desc: The Boat Show studio opens its doors to Francesco Ansalone, Chief Marketing Officer of Arcadia Yachts, who will introduce the new Arcadia A96.

programme.title: Avalon Pontoon Cascade - MIBS 2025 Eng
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at MIBS 2025 aboard the Avalon Pontoon Cascade, a model with refined design and superior performance that offers an ideal combination of comfort and functionality.

programme.title: Viking Yachts Miami 2023 - Discover the best boats with Viking Yachts
programme.desc: Pat Healy, President and CEO of Viking Yachts, highlights the key importance of boat constructions and advanced design developments towards the better future of boating.

programme.title: Grand Banks 85 - A peculiar hull
programme.desc: Justin Ratcliffe is in Cannes on board the Grand Banks 85, the new flagship of the Grand Banks fleet. This boat has a very innovative hull, that is the result of the research on performance and fuel efficiency conducted by the company.

programme.title: wallypower58x - World premiere
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is on board the Wallypower58x for its world premiere. Discover all about this incredible novelty.

programme.title: Pershing GTX 116 The seascape revolution
programme.desc: Are you ready to get a unique on-board experience with the brand-new performance yacht Pershing GTX 116? Follow Maurizio Bulleri as he walks through the speed yacht lovers’ potential suitor.

programme.title: Riva 76 Bahamas Super - Open or Coupé (Eng)
programme.desc: Exclusive test of the Riva 76 Bahamas Super, the new born from the famous Riva shipyard. Hop on board and discover all about it!

programme.title: Poltrona Frau (ENG)
programme.desc: Hop on the Maiora 30 Walkaround, an incredible superyacht with exclusive interiors, signed by Poltrona Frau, one of the most famous Italian design brands. This company was born in 1912 in Turin and today it keeps amazing its clients from all over the world.

programme.title: Ferretti Yachts 860 - 86 feet of lightness
programme.desc: Hop on board the new Ferretti Yachts 860, an incredible 86-foot superyacht. The size of the windows and the openings make the structure aesthetically light.

programme.title: Tankoa Solo - A nautical masterpiece
programme.desc: The Boat Show offers you a special seat to discover magnificent vessels, inside and out. That’s the turn of the Tankoa Solo, a superyacht with a long story and was built with the only goal to be perfect in every way. Discover all the work behind this Italian masterpiece.

programme.title: Riva 68 Diable - Style and emotions
programme.desc: Style and adrenaline have inspired the creation of this new model: the Riva 68 Diable. The performance is astonishing and the sensation experienced while driving is unique, try it for yourself.

programme.title: Extra Yachts X76 at Cannes
programme.desc: Bill Hackett welcomes you onboard the new amazing Extra Yachts X76 Loft, a revolutionary superyacht built in Italy by Extra Yachts, a brand of Palumbo Superyachts.

programme.title: Doctor's Diaries Episode 13
programme.desc: DOCTORS’ DIARIES is a dramatic reality series that delves deep into the lives of the people who save lives in the trauma center and emergency room in a large urban hospital.

programme.title: I Witness Medical Interns Episode 4
programme.desc: Still, young idealistic kids, with images of "GREY’S ANATOMY" floating in their heads are becoming doctors. The question is Why? The video journalists of "I Witness" live, eat and breathe alongside a group of residents at a large New Orleans hospital.

programme.title: 48 hours with Captain Durney
programme.desc: This is 48 Hours is with Capt. Oney Durney at Station 13. This firefigher has been with the department for so many years, they are not really sure as to how old he is. Hes nearing his retirement and trying to get as much time on the job that he loves so much before he has to retire. Take in mind, this guys is on both the USAR and Water Rescue team, we find him on Trucks and Engines, and hes still trys to be first-in. When you see him complete his Wildland Fire Training with his crew, its over 100 degrees, hes in his yellows, shovel or rake in hand, and he is out there heading up his crew. During the sit-down training sessions, hes gaining every bit of knowledge they are teaching today, to us, this guys a true Gladitor in the fire service.In this webisode, some of his brothers and sisters in the fire service give him a shout out.

programme.title: First 24 with Engine 3
programme.desc: Night - Engine 3s Crew gets a few calls. A call comes in for a commercial structure fire, its a guy whos a hoarder. Sparks fly as they gain entry on A, B and D sides. It takes the Fire Crew all night to fight the fire.

programme.title: Doctor's Diaries Episode 8
programme.desc: DOCTORS’ DIARIES is a dramatic reality series that delves deep into the lives of the people who save lives in the trauma center and emergency room in a large urban hospital.

programme.title: Eng 3 Apartment Fire Part 1
programme.desc: The crew of Engine 3s "A" Shift start their day with some of the best tacos in town, a call comes for a fire; the arrive on-scene to a mattress fire possibly set by a homeless person. Then a call comes in for a structure fire. They arrive on scene to a second floor apartment. Captain Palmer takes Command and his crew go into action. Firemen is Garcia on the pump panel, Firefighter Silva pulls the nozzle up the steps, and safely puts on his PPE and they head into the fire.Arson investigation arrives on scene. Back at the station, a quick bit of food, and another call comes in for a structure fire and the Palmer and the crew head out the door.

programme.title: Eng 9 From Brush to Structure Fires
programme.desc: We meet the crew from Engine 9 with Captain Karey Wedemeyer on the B" shift. The morning starts off with them getting new SCBAs, then, they catch a EMS run. Back at the Station, since its the Captains Birthday, everyone, including the cameraman, have to workout to one of Kareys workout DVDs,. The Captain is quite the animal lover, she actually works for a Pit Bull shelter in Fresno. 4:00AM, a call comes in. Its a structure fire, at this fire the Captain meets up with her husband, a Captain on Engine 3s "B" Shift. Once again, youll see Captain Durney, he may be close to retirement, but that does not stop him from doing all he can, all of the time.

programme.title: I Witness Medical Interns Episode 2

programme.title: Doctor's Diaries Episode 6

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 20
programme.desc: A plane, a soldier, a parachute, and nerves of steel. Paratroopers have been an important part of battlefield strategy since World War II.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 1
programme.desc: A wide variety of fighter aircraft are deployed from land and sea under the watchful eye of the men and women who maintain them. The other half of the team--the pilots--share the visceral experience of being inside a vehicle speeding thousands of miles over the earth.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 2
programme.desc: Watch as US Airforce and Army assets work alongside Italian, Croation and Slovenian defense forces for exercise Astral Knight 19, a joint and multinational exercise integrating air and missile defense exercises. Plus additional footage of fighter jets taking off, dropping bombs, and landing in stunning fashion.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 3
programme.desc: Incredible American fighter jet footage from all over the world including Japan, UAE and the US. These jets are taking off, flying high, and refueling in mid air.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 4
programme.desc: Amazing POV footage as if you were in the cockpit flying the jet yourself. A pure rush of adrenaline.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 5
programme.desc: Watch the amazing display of force and grace as these aircraft take off, fly high, and work to defend our freedom.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 6
programme.desc: The US Military flexes its might with some of the strongest, most adaptable ground vehicles in the world. Serve and protect.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 7
programme.desc: Tanks and other wheeled beasts grind across every terrain imaginable during training exercises and while deployed in actual combat. Their versatility is undeniable as they hurtle across sand and snow with equal efficiency

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 8
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part exploration of the militarys mobile cities. Aircraft carriers function like massive well-oiled machines that expand the reach of the armed services.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 9
programme.desc: Part two of a two-part episode on aircraft carriers that shows the sailors and pilots performing the seemingly miraculous task of catching a jet moving at 150 mph on a ships deck thats only 300 ft. long.

programme.title: UFA 319-320 - KOK Bushido 84 Brussels
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings Bushido 84 from Belgium, Brussels part 1. In the Welterweight division, Francisco Cordoba takes on fellow Belgian Bryan Sumbu, Abdelmalek Djebari of France faces Jose Batumeni of Belgium in a heavyweight battle, in a featherweight fight between two young debut fighters, Christevie Mukele faces Alexandre Sever and Edmond Gazarian from Armenia steps into the ring with Josue Ngandu from Belgium. United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings Bushido 84 from Belgium, Brussels part 2. In a heavyweight matchup Jurgen Dolch faces fellow Belgian Mohamed El, two undefeated fighters face off next as Shamil Irisbiev from Belgium takes on David Hawker representing Curaçao, French fighters Ibrahima Sene and Salim El face of next, then in a heavyweight bout, Stanislav Romanov from the Netherlands squares off against Arif Krasniqi from Albania.

programme.title: UFA 317 - Up Next Fighting (UNF) - Millender vs. Ahmadyar
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting, UNF - Millender versus Ahmad from Burbank, CA. In this episode of UFA Christopher Padilla faces El J Portee in a Catchweight bout and Jesse Strader with an 80 knockout rate takes on Taylor Alfaro. The main event is a battle between Northern and Southern California and the title for the UNF Middleweight Championship is on the line when Bellator and UFC veteran Curtis Millender takes on top ranked Salaiman Ahmadyar.

programme.title: UFA 345-346 - Bare Knuckle Boxing 33
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Bare Knuckle Boxing 33 Part 1 from London. In this episode, Sean McPike faces Ash Williams in a battle between Birmingham and Wales. Nathan Decastro takes on Tony Shields, Luke Smith gets in the ring with Corey Healey, Liam Rees fights Joe Fitzpatrick in a flyweight title clash and Bradley Scott current cruiser weight champion faces the challenger Kevin Greenwood for the title. United Fight Alliance presents Bare Knuckle Boxing 33 Part 1 from London part 2. Starting off this episode, Irelands Jonny Lawson battles Brightons Sonny Smith in the Prize Fighter semi-final bout and Aaron Sinclair and Scott McHugh matchup for the second semi-final bout where the winning fighters will head to Thailand for the final match. Dan Lerwell takes on C.J. Mills in the World Middle Weight Title clash and in the main event Jimmy Sweeney takes on Ionel Levitchi.

programme.title: UFA 360-362 - KOK 104 World Series Kaunas
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings 104 World Series Kaunas, Lithuania part 1. Starting the night is a lightweight match between Tiago Mendes and Champion Mindaugas Narauskas. Nika Khelaidze takes on Vitoldas Jagelo in an MMA Bushido contest, Jussi Pirttikangas faces Erikas Golubovskis, Nicola Kisari, making his pro-debut, and Nauris Lukosiunas face off in a Romania versus Lithuania matchup. Also watch Bruno Borges from Portugal take on Lithuanian Samuelis Sorochovas. United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings 104 World Series Kaunas, Lithuania part 2. In this episode Soslan Gasiev faces former heavyweight champion Tomas Pakutinskas, up and comers Arnestas Naujokas and Gustas Dimsa faceoff in the ring, Polands Jakub Kwasniewski faces charasmatic Vitas Karosas from Lithuania, experienced fighters Filip Rzadek and Ignas Barysas look to make their match fight of the night. United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings 104 World Series Kaunas, Lithuania part 3. First up Moldovanian Nicolai Garbuz faces Mantas Kondratavicius of Lithuania in an MMA Bushido bout and Sasa Polugic takes on Mantas Rimdeika for some heavyweight action. In the main event Simon Santana and Matas Pultarazinskas head to the ring for a featherweight bout with the World Championship up for grabs.

programme.title: Dubai: Discover the jewels in the crown of the city's civilisation
programme.desc: When people think of Dubai it is often thought of as a new city. But, in fact, its history goes back more than 5,000 years. Archaeologists have unearthed a series of exciting and mysterious discoveries across the Emirate. These include the Jumeirah Archaeological site, which dates back to the Abbasid Period in the 10th century AD, to the Saruq Al Hadid site – a centre for human inhabitants and trade and metallurgy from the Umm Al Nar period (2600-2000 BCE) to the Iron Age. When the Jumeirah Archaeological site was discovered, experts noticed that the walls of the buildings there were plastered. Dr Mansour Boraik, an archaeology specialist from Dubai, said: "It was plastered inside and outside with white plaster. When they tried to picture the city during the Abbasid Period, and they imagined that it would look like a white city from the shores of the Gulf." The site shows Dubai during the Abbasid period which is around the 10th century AD. The geographical location of the site is important. It sits on the shoreline of Dubai but also on the major trade route between Mesopotamia, India and Oman. It also sits in-between the Arabic and Indian peninsular. The 80,000 square metre site sits in the shadow of the Burj Khalifa and the imposing Dubai skyline, emphasising the comparison between old and new worlds. The circular and semi-circular tower supports reflect the prosperity of the inhabitants of the time who will have been a mixture of locals and passing tradesmen. A variety of silver coins, pottery, copper, glass and stone artefacts have been excavated. Its one of the largest and most important Islamic sites ever discovered in the Gulf. It is also home to the oldest Mosque discovered in the UAE. Saruq al Hadid Saruq al Hadid is regarded as the jewel in the crown of archaeological discoveries In Dubai. This ancient industrial metallurgical centre dates back to the Iron Age and indicates that Dubai was a global trading hub. Ahmed Mahmoud, Director of Architectural Heritage Department in Dubai, said

programme.title: La Mer: Dubai's bohemian beachfront
programme.desc: Postcards heads down to La Mer, Dubais newest beachfront development to check out the vintage-style beach huts, water sports, restaurants, bars, fashion stores and street art. A magnet for Instagrammers, La Mer is one of Dubai’s most colourful seaside destinations. The street art here talks to its audience. Visitors can hire a sunbed or rent a whole day room on the sand, and the multi-coloured beach huts house showers. And, if you fancy an ice cream, youll find some interesting flavours. "Here at iScream , we’re very crazy; thats why we have crazy flavours like curry, kulfi, ketchup, Mexican chilli-chocolate and you name it," says iSreams Managing Partner, Rami Halawi. ​At the confluence of north and south La Mer, you’ll find Laguna Water Park . Here you can test your courage on slides knotted with surprise twists and turns, or learn to surf on the 180-degree wave machine by Flowrider. For more wet and wild adventures, head to the beach – there are two water sports centres with a huge range of activities. Its also possible to explore the coast on a guided jet ski tour. Those who prefer airborne adventures can bounce around at Hawa Hawa , the weird and wavy trampoline-like playground imported from Japan. For those who just want to relax and chill out, dont worry, theres still plenty to do. Before day slips into night, secure a seat with sunset views at one of La Mer’s beautiful beachfront eateries. Masti is known for its mixology and its modern Indian cuisine. ​ If thats not enough, La Mer has a vintage-style cinema, fabulous street performers and seasonal celebrations to keep visitors entertained all night long. ​

programme.title: Animal conservation "a government priority" says United Arab Emirates
programme.desc: Dubai and the United Arab Emirates are making animal conservation a government priority at a time when biodiversity is under threat and more animals face extinction globally. A report by the United Nations earlier this year claimed animal extinctions are at an unprecedented high. According to the organisation, as many as one million species are under threat. On a visit to the desert, you might expect to find camels or antelope, maybe some hawks. But Dubai’s Al Marmoom animal sanctuary is teeming with biodiversity with hundreds of different species of birds, mammals, and reptiles. The sanctuary covers 20 percent of the whole area of Dubai. In the beginning, it was a desert populated by native animals, but as the sanctuary expanded to more than 50 oases, it was discovered these water bodies could control the environmental balance. The sanctuary has even managed to attract the Arabian Oryx. This animal was declared extinct in the wild in 1972, but has now been brought back from the brink by the reserve. Saoud Faisal is a wildlife officer at the Al Marmoom sanctuary. He says in the 80s and 90s the Oryx were overhunted for food. Now the animal is considered part of the regions wildlife. “They are totally protected now and also they are healthy,” he explains. “We have them in large numbers which last year reached more than 500." From desert oases to indoor tropical environments, recent laws in Dubai mean greater governmental support for animal sanctuaries. Laws were introduced in 2007 to cover animal welfare, but awareness really started to build in 2016. The laws also apply to rare and exotic animals. Some are looked after in animal sanctuaries like Green Planet. Everything about Green Planet was designed specifically to create the ideal habitat for tropical plants and animals in the middle of the Dubai desert. The sanctuary houses a wide range of species including many different birds, and mammals such as two-toed sloths. And lizards like green iguanas or basilisks. The latest addition t

programme.title: Shanghai Me - A taste of 1930's China
programme.desc: A favourite for Royalty, celebrities and sports stars, Shanghai Me transports its guests back in time to pre-war China. Taste finds out why this fine-dining restaurant has been voted one of the best in the gulf region. Shanghai in the 1930s was called the Paris of the East. One restaurant that’s capturing that flavour is Shanghai Me in Dubai’s financial district. Exuding the atmosphere the Orient, this establishment offers a unique dining experience. Euronews Evan Bourke paid a visit to meet Head Chef Shane Macneill, who cooked one of the restaurants signature dishes, black cod. Click on the video link above to watch the full episode.

programme.title: Taipei
programme.desc: Being underestimated, is one of the biggest advantages. Maybe that’s what makes Taipei a unique city and one of Asia’s best kept secrets when it comes to food, fun, and all things lifestyle. Often under-reported and overlooked, Taiwan’s global impact for such a small island is breathtaking. When it comes to Taiwan and food, experts and enthusiasts alike know that they go hand-in-hand. It is no wonder Taipei is overflowing with electricity as new ideas and re-imagined classics are popping up all over town. This magical friction is a big reason Taipei’s food scene is attracting young talent from the world’s best kitchens looking to experiment, innovate, and test their ideas against the discerning palates of the local crowds. Highlighted by some of the world’s best produce, great transportation, magnificent hiking trails 5 minutes from downtown, a vibrant nightlife, and an openness towards travelers and new faces makes Taipei one of Black Buddha’s favorite cities.

programme.title: Top 5 Things to do in the British Virgin Islands
programme.desc: Teri travels to the British Virgin Islands to explore the top things to do including sailing, diving, island hopping, indulging in spa treatments, and visiting the world famous Baths. Teri later visits the Bomba Shack on Tortola and talks with its legendary owner, Bomba.

programme.title: Taste Dubai: An Emirati Iftar
programme.desc: During Ramadan, practising Muslims abstain from eating and drinking during daylight hours. The meal that follows is known as Iftar, and you do not have to be Muslim to partake in one. In this edition of Taste, Euronews visited the Jumeirah Zabeel Saray Hotel in Dubai, to sample the special Iftar menu produced by the worlds first Emirati chef. After Athan, the call for evening prayer, Muslims who have been fasting all day can finally eat and drink. The fast is broken by first eating dates. This is of great religious significance, chef Musabbeh Al Kaabi explained. "Prophet Mohammed used to do this when he was breaking his fast, so we always break it with the dates then laban (a fermented milk drink) or water," he said. Chef Musabbeh first served up a traditional dish - king rice. Its name comes from its historically prestigious status as an expensive dish only eaten by royalty or the rich. "Liver is there, beef is there, saffron rice is there. So it’s all luxury things. I have cooked saffron rice, I have fried cauliflower, boiled chickpeas. Now I need to take the flavour of the onions with all these things," Chef Musabbeh said as he prepared the dish. "I will put the rice in now. I’ll put some spices in as well. So now, I’m going to put it on a plate, and I’m going to garnish it" But, before eating, everyone said Bismillā, which means in the name of Allah. Chef Musabbeh then prepared his second dish the famous Emirati ouzi with oriental rice, a lamb dish with cinnamon and cardamom. You can make the dish yourself by following the recipe below: Chef Musabbehs Ouzi and Oriental Rice Recipe Ingredients: 1100g lamb shank 500g of basmati rice 100g of minced lamb 2 bay leaves 3 cinnamon sticks 10g of garlic - freshly chopped 120g of onion - freshly chopped 100g of tomato - freshly chopped 20g of ghee butter Salt and pepper 6.5ml of water 10g of tamarind powder 40g of Emirati spices 30g of tomato paste 40g of coriander - freshly chopped Instructions: 1. Chop the onions, garli

programme.title: Vegetarian in NYC's East Village
programme.desc: Musician, New Yorker, and vegetarian Jesse Malin gives his recommendations for the best vegetarian food in New Yorks East Village.

programme.title: Exploring Virgin Gorda in the British Virgin Islands
programme.desc: Teri meets with Miss World BVI who tells her a little about the islands before they jump into their bikinis and explore the world famous Baths in Virgin Gorda. Teri later talks to Celebrity Chef Fed about what hes doing in Virgin Gorda for Restaurant Week.

programme.title: From screen to plate: the MasterChef restaurant goes live
programme.desc: Its the most successful cookery television format in the world having been adapted in 52 countries and viewed by over 250 million people worldwide. Now the MasterChef TV Experience is going from screen to plate with a new restaurant in Dubai. Its a world first, and Euronews Jane Witherspoon went to check it out. Shaun O’Neale was champion of MasterChef US Season 7 . He says the contest was one of the most stressful and hardest things hes ever done. "Youve got Gordon Ramsay screaming down your throat if youre not doing something right. But, it was the most rewarding thing, the most fulfilling thing. It really showed me my true passion and my true love for food. So its about time for people to come in and experience and get a taste of that mystery box." Now Sean and other MasterChef champions will be in residency at the MasterChef TV Experience - where they will also compose their own personal menus. Running the show In charge of the kitchen, the restaurants Head Chef, Margarita Vaamonde-Beggs. She says the MasterChef brand is a perfect fit for a restaurant - and for Dubai. "I believe that we stand out for us because we have already a huge fan base. In the Dubai market, it’s a city of foodies and it means something to so many people around the world." The Mystery Box One highlight on the menu is based on the shows Mystery Box challenge. Guests choose secret ingredients from the box and chefs have 35 minutes to create an original dish. And thats the dish Euronews wants. Today the Mystery Box ingredients include black garlic, Jerusalem artichokes, fresh oregano and a variety of mushrooms. They look delicious but will barely more than half-an-hour be enough time to turn them into a meal? Chef Margarita isnt worried: "We are going to be on time. Its going to be fine." It gets down to wire but 35 minutes later, with not a second to spare, Chef Margarita has produced a mouth-watering stuffed raviolo, covered with chocolate and black garlic. Not only does it taste amazing,

programme.title: St. Croix Food and Wine Experience
programme.desc: Andrea and Teri enjoy the Taste of St. Croix as they sample the best in Caribbean cuisine, rum and wine from around the world. The next day, Andrea heads to the Sunset Barbeque where she talks to Chef Theo Gumbs and Evelyn Paul about their preparations and passion for cooking. The episode ends with Teri dining at Beachside Café where she tastes the culinary treats designed by Chef Chad Ford and get a delightful, melodic finish to her dining experience.

programme.title: Durban Nature Trails
programme.desc: Durban, South Africa: Durbans natural spaces and canopy of trees provide vital space for nature

programme.title: Kristen Taekman's NYC Fashion Finds
programme.desc: Model, mommy, housewife & entrepreneur Kristen Taekman keeps us stylish with her favorite fashion finds in New York City. See her list here!

programme.title: Li Qun Duck
programme.desc: Zhang Li Qun welcomes you to his home to experience this classic delicacy. And when we say classic, we mean the ultimate classic. Throughout the years, there have been many spins on Peking Duck, even in Beijing. However, Li Qun Duck roasts their duck in accordance with the Qing Imperial Kitchen and their production methods, including the traditional hanging furnace technique. In a very proud city rich with historical heritage, this is about as local as it gets. Tucked away in the winding hutongs of the Qianmen area, do not miss this hidden gem….you will savor this taste of old Beijing for eternity.

programme.title: The Ghosts of Greenland
programme.desc: In a land of stark beauty and natural extremes, a colony of Viking settlers vanished centuries ago. Follow along as our writer travels on a National Geographic ship from Iceland to Greenland and into a remote fjord — to seek the truth.

programme.title: Kanda
programme.desc: One way to think about Kanda is to picture early Brooklyn, before the hipsters completely took over. It’s a place that perfectly embodies old and new Tokyo, a university town that attracts more than students. It’s a great place to live (some even think it’s one of the best kept secrets of Tokyo) with just about everything you need in one place — restaurants, nightlife, shopping, and easy access to just about any other part of the city. While tall gleaming skyscrapers haven’t taken over the landscape like much of Tokyo, there’s a good balance of historical and contemporary architecture to keep things interesting.Walk around and you’ll find neighborhood pockets that focusing on one thing: an entire street of used bookstores, another with stores and stores hawking vintage and new guitars; a three-story mecca for old-school arcade games; an entire block for ski and snowboarding gear. You can find Michelin-starred restaurants, gyoza specialists, internationally known ramen shops, and even great burger joints around the corner from each other. With friendly and fiercely proud locals who want to share the area’s history, from origami to the Kanda Myojin Shrine, this is a quieter part of Tokyo just waiting to be discovered.

programme.title: Seoul
programme.desc: South Korea has been making waves on a global scale. Across Asia and the rest of the world, this capital city is a pulsating force in pop-culture and beauty. Like its denizens - well-dressed, confident, and proud - this influential city pushes the new frontiers while honoring its 2,000 year old heritage. Emerging as one of Asia’s tastemaker-cultures, Seoul births new trends in foods, fashion, beauty, technology, and entertainment. From 24hr shopping in Dongdaemun, hanging in HongDae, strolling down Garosugil, or drowning yourself in the different party scenes that define Itaewon and Gangnam’s nightlife, Seoul is trendy, vibrant, and engaging. While each neighborhood has its own distinction, Seoul pours out its love generously to all of its residents and visitors with each sip of soju or bite of kimchi. Whether you come for the food, the people, or the party, trust us, you’ll feel like you’re the underdog as the city test your limits. We love Seoul.

programme.title: Cruise the Caribbean with Sail Windjammer
programme.desc: The sails are raised in Grenada on the 236-foot Mandalay. The ships 19 passengers arent sure exactly where this seven-day cruise will take us. The captain will only say this: "Youll be amazed." Islands photographer Jon Whittle captures what happens next.

programme.title: Where To Indulge in Chicago
programme.desc: Think Chicago is just deep-dish pizza and hot dogs? Lifestyle expert & Chicago native Bahar Takhtechian shares her favorite Chicago restaurants.

programme.title: Panoramic Paramotoring
programme.desc: It consists of a tricycle, an engine powering a propeller that fills a canopy and - thankfully- a back-up canopy. One of the smallest aircraft in the world, Paramotors are the latest way to take to the skies above Dubais sand dunes. And as its wing rises, so does Euronews James OHagans nerves: "My pilot Jos assures me he’s never needed it ( the backup wing)." The morning mist clears and Jos Vandenbroucke, General manager pf Paramotor Desert Adventure, has given the word to go ahead. "Ready for rock and roll? he says. "We’re like 40/50 metres. No more. We can easily go up to 12,000 feet. In case we have an engine failure, it’s just doing this (Jos turns off engine)." Paramotors are one of the smallest aircraft in the world and have a great safety record because the engine is only needed for gaining altitude and can be switched off when you come back down to land. "We will do a spiral. If you can’t hold it anymore James, you just shout." "Now we do a 360 to the right. Yalla, here we go!" "The G-force in your stomach is class!" says OHagan. Flying over a stretch of desert reserve, you can see an array of wildlife; families of camels, Arabian oryx and even a tower of giraffes. "After that, I think I can safely say that I’ve got over my fear of flying and kiss the ground," says OHagan.

programme.title: Eating Healthy in LA
programme.desc: Get the lowdown on health foodie finds in LA from food blogger Jackie Gebel, otherwise known as @noleftovers_ on Instagram.

programme.title: Vanessa Huang
programme.desc: Vanessa HuangWe sat down with Vanessa Huang, owner and chef of Ephernite, a French restaurant that’s popular among those in the know. Vanessa’s restaurant celebrates delicious dishes and memorable moments. She talks us through her inspiration behind what is one of Taipei’s most warm and authentic French dining experiences.Interview: Vanessa HuangActually our restaurant is unlike others in Taiwan, in that our menu is different everyday. We make adjustments based on our daily findings at the market, and we design our menu around that. For example, if we see really fresh seafood or vegetables or meat, we’ll put that on the menu.I can’t really say that I have one signature dish, and even when our guests keep coming week after week asking for a specific dish, I get bored of making the same thing and will want to move on to something else. What I like is giving our guests something new every time.A very special moment for me is when my parents go to the fields themselves and handpick ingredients for me, like lemongrass, lily flower root, etc, and I’ll use them to make ice cream or appetizers. And the part that makes me most proud and happy is when I get to tell our customers, ‘this was handpicked by my mom!’. But of course, it doesn’t happen often, only sometimes when the chance arises.I went to France at the end of 2002, to attend the cooking school, Ferrandi. At the time I just wanted to have my own little coffee shop, like most young girls. But one day my chef, my mentor at the school, asked me if I wanted to do a stage (internship) at a 3 starred Michelin restaurant, he thought it was a great opportunity for me. I agreed, not even knowing what Michelin was, and that experience would go on to change my life.Being the only female and foreigner student during my stage, I didn’t want to lose to everyone else, and I would push myself to keep up. Although it was daunting and disheartening when I couldn’t understand my teacher, I continued to give it my all, and at the time I felt like maybe I was working harder than othe

programme.title: Downtown Eats in NYC
programme.desc: Get the lowdown on best restaurants in downtown Manhattan from Andrew Zimmer, former NY editor at Thrillist and current Deputy Editor at Time Out New York.

programme.title: Best Asian Restaurants in the U.S
programme.desc: Lucky Rice founder Danielle Chang knows the Asian food scene in America. Watch her recommendations for dumplings, dim sum and Peking duck.

programme.title: Mrs. Pound
programme.desc: Dont judge a book by its cover, this is not your average stamp shop. Inspired by a fictional story of secret lovers, Mrs. Pound brings to life the story of a former 1950s Shanghai burlesque dancer, her married lover (Mr. Ming) and their elaborate clandestine rendezvous space. Offering a new twist on asian fusion cuisine, the 45 seat venue features a lower dining room (Mrs. Pound), an upper dining room (Mr . Ming), and a bar area at which these two spaces merge. Mixed with plush velvet banquettes, vintage tiles, neon artwork, suspended mirrored marquee lights with lipstick messages, and a 1960s style showgirl glamour, Mrs. Pounds creative interior sets the tone for a unique and entertaining culinary (and drinking) experience. We like the Hainanese Chicken Rice, Thai Milk Tea Cake, Sriracha Street Corn, and Lemongrass Pork Chop. Although it will be a longer wait, do yourself a favor and go for dinner for the best experience.

programme.title: Marco Bettio
programme.desc: Owner and founder Marco Bettio speaks about his journey to success, and bringing a bit of "Italian Love" to Shanghai.Marco’s infectious personality immediately disarms you, it’s no wonder Goodfellas is one of the city’s best establishments to find authentic Italian comfort food. His passion for authenticity and obsession for comfort, pours out every minute you spend here. This place has a charming personality and we went directly to the source.Interview: MARCO BETTIOWhen I came here 10 years ago and started to do some consulting. I started to receive a lot of guests from all around the world..and I was always forced to bring them to fine dining places. I noticed that my clients weren’t really comfortable in the fine dining experience the first day they arrived in Shanghai.That’s what moved me to bring this real Italian dining experience to this area. I would say that we would always try to give a tailormade type of service. Greeting everybody, making them feel comfortable, it’s one of the most important things for us.Actually, “Goodfellas”..is meant to mean “good friends”..and this is the idea. There is no ego, there is no name of the chef, or my name on the door,..nothing but “Goodfellas.” It’s a place to for a good time with your friends, business partners, clients..to have an intimate experience in an enjoyable way.Chef Antonio is a great master, we actually call him “the maestro”,..it’s the italian way to address a very experienced chef. Since day one, Chef has been in charge of everything inside the kitchen...scouting the best ingredients and creating the recipes. Coming from big hotels, he initially wanted the kitchen to be very serious, less smiling, less interactive, etc..I never agreed with this, so we had to find a balance. And it took almost a year until we found that balance,...after he saw the happy customers and atmosphere we knew we were on to something and it because very harmonic. There is never an argument between the kitchen and the staff, and it’s amazing. This is a very big achievement..norma

programme.title: Find out why medical tourism is big business in Dubai
programme.desc: Medical tourism is a booming global industry, estimates on market size vary but the Patients Without Borders publishing group puts its value at around €60 to €80 billion worldwide, each year, with 20 to 24 million patients travelling for medical treatments annually. Around the world, aging populations, rising healthcare costs, and pressures on the insurance industry have created opportunities for destinations like Dubai , that have been able to invest rapidly in their healthcare infrastructure and capitalise on the sharp increase in demand for health tourism. Encouraging international institutions Dr Marwan Mohamed Al Mulla, CEO, Health Regulation Sector, Dubai Health Authority said, “Recently a new law has come into effect which encourages and allows international institutions to have their own, 100 percent ownership The Dubai Health Authority has had a medical tourism strategy in place since 2014 with the aim of developing and supporting its healthcare sector and steadily increasing its contribution towards Dubais gross domestic product. Focusing on an inbound patient’s airport-to-airport needs has helped providers capitalise too. Dr Basel Nasrallah, Medical Director, Armada said, “We in our facility, for example, get about 5 percent more patients from abroad. Patients are coming from all around the world. We are receiving patients from Russia, mainly Europe, Italy, Spain, UK, and North America from Africa, from South Asia Why have health checks in Dubai? Interestingly, many of those countries are known for the strength of their own medical tourism offerings, but Dubai is still an attractive option for patients who are looking to combine their treatments with other pursuits. Alexander Edwards, Surgical Patient, from the UK said, “Well there were multiple aspects I looked at prior to coming obviously looking at the time it takes, for the recovery period. I had all the research done before I came and found some fantastic reviews, very positive feedback from other friends and family that

programme.title: Classic NYC Burgers
programme.desc: Travel Savvy asked Americas foremost hamburger expert George Motz to find the best burger in NYC. Check out these local New York burger places on your trip!

programme.title: Run, Bike, Sweat Your Way Through London
programme.desc: Fitness lovers-if your visit to London includes running, biking, yoga and fueling up with juices, weve got the spots where you can sweat and refresh.

programme.title: Tucson, Arizona: A Premiere Culinary Destination
programme.desc: WATCH: Ever since Tucson was designated a World City of Gastronomy by UNESCO the world has taken notice of all the flavor & culinary history this southern Arizona town has to offer

programme.desc: Have fun like a kid. Andrew Zimmer tells us where to get ice cream, play video games, go bowling, and more things to do in Brooklyn.

programme.title: Tel Aviv Eats
programme.desc: From falafel and hummus to wine and bottomless brunch, these local Tel Aviv hotspots come highly recommended by our favorite Instagram-famous foodies!

programme.title: Travel to Mentawai: The Faraway Escape You Must See
programme.desc: Just off the coast of Indonesia, the Mentawai Islands are an exotic travel and surfing destination.

programme.title: How to Crack a Coconut (the Barbados Way)
programme.desc: Brian "de Action Man" Talma, a Bajan islander, shares his secrets for how to open a coconut like a local in Bardados.

programme.title: Best Places to Cycle Near NYC
programme.desc: Jimmy Phillips, founder of personal cycling tour company The Domestique, shares his favorite locations to go cycling in & around New York - see the spots here!

programme.title: Redbird
programme.desc: If youve ever wanted to eat a standout meal from a veteran chef on the grounds of an old Baroque-style cathedral—and who hasnt?—Redbird can offer you that unique experience. The acclaimed restaurant is attached to the historic St. Vibiana cathedral downtown. Youve probably seen chef Neal Fraser on TV, whether it was cooking on Top Chef Masters or beating Bobby Flay in a fried chicken sandwich Throwdown, but hes also been one of LAs more influential chefs over his tenured career. Brunching in the spectacular glass-enclosed atrium courtyard is always a great idea, where you can munch on BLUEBERRY RICOTTA PANCAKES or more refined dishes like a FOIE GRAS TORCHON with strawberry and pink peppercorn. Dont miss happy hour either. CHICKEN-FRIED SWEETBREADS paired with a $7 gin cocktail is a hard offer to pass up.

programme.title: Monkey Island
programme.desc: Needing a break from the bright lights of the big city? An escape to a simpler way of life is just a 90 minute trip from Bangkok to Monkey Island in Samut Songkhram province. For 700bht you can take a boat ride to meet the famous swimming monkeys and see how the local fishing community (Khlong Klone) lives. After feeding those ravenous monkeys some bananas, treat yourself to some amazing local seafood. It may be a perfect end to a low key Sunday after a night of the other kind of monkey business.

programme.title: Tokyo
programme.desc: When you look out your taxi window here, you see life in High-Definition (HD). Tokyo glistens and glows with precision and truly stands in a class of her own. Every street, alley, and crevice lends itself as a gateway to adventures with endless possibilities. A city rooted in heavy history and tradition, but propelled by innovation and imagination, Tokyo has a spellbinding flare for artisan culture, creativity, and design. There is no place like it on Earth, and being home to more Michelin stars than any other place in the world is merely a symbol of Tokyoites devotion to craftsmanship and inventiveness. This city is an endless feast of inspiration - exploring the unknown and finding new paths is highly recommended. Remember to stay humble and behave respectfully, because good manners and thoughtfulness are the real ways to truly experiencing Tokyo and making a few fabulous friends along the way.

programme.title: Beijing
programme.desc: Being the capital of China is a colossal responsibility. With over a billion people watching, Beijing seems to manage the task with dignified ease. The pace of life in this city speaks volumes about its personality and its characters. The mood is steady, confident, and proud. With walls that never end, ducks that bear golden skin, and Forbidden Cities out in the open, Beijing has a storybook magic that can only be found in a megacity overflowing with such rich history and tradition. The landmarks and landscapes are dominant forces, followed by the new developments mounted by modernization. Knowing where to look will be the key to unlocking the cities best adventures and experiences. Don’t be afraid to explore the many interesting nooks and crannies of Beijing’s streets and alleys, as there are many. From the bucket list worthy monuments, to the waves of new restaurants, shops, and cultural encounters available, be sure not to rush. Beijing is a hotbed of commerce and entrepreneurship, and inspires the country’s top artists, students, writers, film-makers, musicians, and creatives to converge within its frontiers. With so much to explore in one of the oldest cities on the planet, traveling somewhere else seems irresponsible - there’s no place like ‘the capital.’

programme.title: Michaela Guzy's Top Unexpected NYC Experiences
programme.desc: Michaela Guzy, New Yorker and founder of the website Oh The People You Meet, shares her favorite hidden gems in the city.

programme.title: The Incomparable 80's in NYC
programme.desc: From Bushwick to the Metropolitan Opera, the 80s are alive and well at these locals. See what writer/director James Habacker has to say about old school NYC!

programme.title: Best Brooklyn Eats
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmer, editor at Time Out New York, shares his favorite Brooklyn restaurants and international eateries. Find out the best Brooklyn restaurants here.

programme.title: Toh A
programme.desc: In the wave of casual fine dining sweeping Asia, Toh A offers French-Taiwanese fusion that packs a nice punch. In addition to the set menu of excellence, the next most intriguing part of the restaurant is surely its interior design. Built during the Japanese colonial period, the building is over a hundred years old and was even used as a previous dormitory for the National Taiwan University. The original wooden rooftop still remains within the walled gates that open up to modern , Asian interior design that immediately make the outside world melt away. With a rotational set menu, Toh A offers a culinary experience that presents traditional Taiwanese cuisine with a modern French twist unlike any other establishment in Taipei today.

programme.title: Travel Deals for Millennials
programme.desc: Twenty-something and on a budget? Whether youre looking for a cheap Spring Break destination or a weekend post-grad getaway, heres how to save money on travel!

programme.title: Find Cheap Drinks with These Apps!
programme.desc: Whats better than a free drink at your favorite bar? If your answer was "nothing," youll love these three mobile apps that can help you find the best cheap drinks in your area.

programme.title: Brunch in Manhattan
programme.desc: A guide to the best brunch spots in NYC that includes oysters, avocado toast, best rosé wine list, Southern California menu, and farm-to-table for weekend brunch.

programme.title: Jilsiru Tteok Cafe
programme.desc: At first blush, the Jilsiru Tteok Cafe may strike more adventurous explorers as a bit of a snoozefest. Its a cafe attached to an actual Tteok museum (koreans take their rice cakes seriously) inside the old, traditional Insadong neighborhood. Nothing new or trendy but its actually one of those places that you may find yourself wandering back into after your initial bad attitude. The first floor houses the Tteok Cafe where one can essentially purchase and eat every variety of Tteok known to mankind pretty much. The textures and fillings are as varied as the many colors that are on display and its easy to mindlessly go into a tteok-frenzy but it pays to be selective because theres only so much glutinous rice hunks one can eat in one sitting and tteok is known to go stale quickly.When youve had your fill of colorful starch, head up to the 2nd floor where you can find the museum part of the experience and learn about the thousands of years of tteok history. And if youre wanting a little more action after, head on over to the traditional Korean Liquor Museum which is in the same building.In total, this place really is a hub for Koreas days of yore, including spreads on North Korean cuisine and what emperors have been served . Just make sure you come brave enough to try the dried manta ray.

programme.title: On Two Wheels: A history of Supercross : E22
programme.desc: The battle continues in 1988. At the Dallas supercross Rick Johnson and Jeff Ward go head-to-head on a fresh track with more gravel than ever seen before.

programme.title: It's How You Get There : It's How You Get Where?
programme.desc: An adventure has been planned, the competition is set, the vehicles are ready. But where are we going? Air, land, sea-- the racing is going to be fast, the competition stiff, and the stakes high for this finale episode!

programme.desc: After crashing a Hawaiian Tropic Girls photo shoot, The Ice Cream Men From Hell finally arrive at The Florence Prison Run and find out the real meaning of honor and brotherhood. They are flying high from their ride with the Hells Angels, but the high-speeds are causing dissension among the members - and Kevin turns in his colors. A visit to historic Tombstone gives Baker pause and makes him re-think the ICMFH patch and asks the members to vote on giving it up. Is this the end of the club?

programme.desc: After growing up as a self sufficient only child, Brad went into university for mechanical engineering with an MBA in entrepreneurship. Now his goal is to help other succeed though the power of a highly equipped team. His mission is to create a better wor

programme.title: The Celestial Wars
programme.desc: Finndelar (Tom) and Hogar (Dan) have arrived in the Sunken City and are now searching for the magical device they have journeyed so far for. After meeting the craftsman Arkie Fint, they travel to Smithy's tavern in hope of finding a clue to their mystery...

programme.title: The Celestial Wars
programme.desc: Smithy's party has proven to be entertaining and everyone is enjoying themselves. Meanwhile, during the festivities, Bludgy, the city's most notorious thief is seen sneaking upstairs, drawing the attention of others. Finn and Hogar's mission hangs in the balance...

programme.title: The Celestial Wars
programme.desc: Finn and Hogar are tied up below Smithy's tavern along with a few others. Bludgy is about to sell off the crystal rod for a life changing amount ofgold, while Arkie is "retrieving" something important from his workshop.

programme.title: The Celestial Wars
programme.desc: The party, now in possession of the CRYSTAL ROD, has fled from the thieves in the Sunken City through the underground tunnels. Once outside, they discover the Queen's forces are invading from the sea, bombarding the city. They quickly slip out beyond the walls, north of the city... but to go where?

programme.title: The Celestial Wars
programme.desc: The party has been caught trying to escape and with them, the Artifact. Eventually they wake up shackled to a cart, and surrounded by guards on their way back into the occupied Sunken City… at the mercy of the Queen's Forces.

programme.title: The Celestial Wars
programme.desc:
"The party has adjusted to their new lives the best ways they know, how but they are eager to escape.
Follow the party as they continue working their 9 to 5 jobs with only one lunch break and four 15 minute coffee breaks fun by the evil Queen’s forces."

programme.title: El Tribuno Del Pueblo

programme.desc: Chirali discusses her upcoming free series to help black and brown entrepreneurs navigate the complex cannabis licensing process in New Jersey.

programme.title: Starting A Cannabis Company In Illinois
programme.desc: Entrepreneur and cannabis attorney Akele Parnell discusses winning operating licenses in Chicago, IL.

programme.title: The Pathway To Black Ownership In Cannabis
programme.desc: Multi-State Cannabis Executive Chima Enyia discusses how to foster black ownership in the regulated cannabis industry.

programme.title: Backstage with Bell Biv DeVoe
programme.desc: We go backstage with Bell Biv DeVoe as they get ready for their long-anticipated New Edition reunion tour. Then we catch up with Curtis Benjamin, the founder of Save Our Daughters.” Hes on a mission to help daughters around the country. Then we talk to Ron Hickland, the engineer behind some of Americas top performing bowling balls. Hes shows us the career benefits of a STEM education. And finally, Dr. Khalil Muhammad shows us how hes lifting his community through the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture.

programme.title: Fighting for Our Environment with Wawa Gatheru
programme.desc: Wawa Gatheru, one of the world’s most influential environmental justice advocates, shares why Black women are at high risk in the climate crisis.

programme.title: NASCAR Now View From A Black Woman Leader
programme.desc: Now ranked one of the top motorsports organizations in the world, NASCAR has come a long way from its “Dukes of Hazard” image as a pastime reserved for southern white good ole boys—thanks in no small part to the launch of its Drive for Diversity program nearly 20 years ago. Exhibit A: Latasha Causey, the first Black woman president of a NASCAR racing venue, Phoenix Raceway—home of NASCAR Championship Weekend. Causey joins Beyond The Hype to share her journey and give an inside look at how NASCAR is growing its fan base, especially in Black communities.

programme.title: Celebrating the Enduring Legacy of Bernie Mac
programme.desc: A King of Comedy, one of Danny Ocean’s 11 (and 12 and 13), the bark-worse-than-bite, everyman TV dad—Bernie Mac will forever be all these things and more to a fan base that is more loyal than ever 15 years since his passing in 2008. However, no one knows and appreciates the man—Bernard Jeffrey McCullough—like his beloved only child, Je’Niece McCullough. Proudly claiming her identity as “Bernie Mac’s Daughter” (and ahead of launching a new podcast with the same title), the speaker and writer joins Beyond The Hype to share intimate insight into her eternal love for her dad, and her calling to celebrate his enduring legacy.

programme.title: Motherland
programme.desc: From Emmy-nominated director Ramona S. Diaz, MOTHERLAND is an absorbingly intimate, verite look at the busiest maternity hospital on the planet, in one of the world’s most populous countries: the Philippines. This Sundance award-winning film drops the viewer into the hospital’s stream of activity to reveal the miracle and wonder of the human condition.

programme.title: Slutever: Alternative Sex Ed

programme.title: Maynard
programme.desc: Director Sam Pollard constructs a portrait of charismatic trailblazer Maynard Jackson, who became Atlanta’s first black mayor. The son of pastors raised in the segregated South, Jackson entered college at 14 and took office at 35. During his three-term tenure, he led the city through the traumatic Atlanta child murders and triumphantly hosted the 1996 Olympics, all while championing racial equality.

programme.title: Magic of Zion
programme.desc: Experience the magnificent Zion National Park in its autumn splendor! Brilliant autumn colors combine with the warm red tones of Zions dramatic cliffs to create a visual feast like no other in" Magic of Zion". Also included is rare footage of the endangered American Condor, the largest flying land bird in North America. Watch as a wild parent Condor feeds and nurtures its fledgling on the cliffs of Zion, an awe inspiring sight since there used to be only 50 condors in existence. Available now to subscribers of NatureStream.tv. Runtime 82 minutes.

programme.title: Preview for "Autumn's Grace: The Wasatch Mountains"
programme.desc: The Wasatch mountains of Utah display natures finest autumn colors. The stunning spectrum of the landscape ranges from dark reds to bright yellows, splashed across the mountains in exuberant splendor. A soothing acoustic soundtrack accompanies the scenery, filmed from above and within the autumn splendor of the Wasatch mountains. This is a free preview for the 1 hour 50 minute film available to subscribers at www.NatureStream.tv.

programme.title: Hawaii, A Journey Through The Big Island
programme.desc: Experience Big Island bliss in the stunning 2 hour relaxing nature film. Soar above waterfalls that plunge into the Pacific, kick back with views of beach sunsets and slow motion waves, enjoy island palms in the gentle island breezes, and experience the Waipio valley paradise from above. Dazzling cinematography is accompanied by a relaxing soundtrack. Run time 2 hours.

programme.title: Journey Through Pinnacles National Park
programme.desc: Immerse yourself in the rugged beauty of Pinnacles National Park, where towering rock spires, serene trails, and sweeping vistas come to life. Journey Through Pinnacles National Park captures the park’s unique landscapes, from sunlit cliffs to quiet caves and abundant wildlife. Let the peaceful sounds and stunning views transport you to one of California’s hidden natural gems. The full 45 minute film is available to subscribers of www.NatureStream.tv

programme.title: The Rise of Frank Shamrock
programme.desc: S1:E2 Frank Shamrock was one of the toughest fighters to ever compete in the UFC. He holds the world record for the fastest consecutive knockouts, but his biggest fight happened when he was a child, living with his stepfather. His stepfather emotionally abused him so devastatingly, that even when Frank was sent to a Juvenile Detention Center, the other kids couldn’t believe what he went through. While many kids would be crushed under such pain and suffering, Frank Shamrock was determined to prove why warriors always find a way to win.

programme.title: The Rise of Charity Witt
programme.desc: S1:E5 Dubbed The Worlds Strongest Barbie, Charity suffered a heart attack when she was only 17 years old, due to being overworked and poor life choices. This health crisis lead her to change her mindset by taking action on changing her life, that put her on a path that lead her to becoming an elite powerlifter, a Strongwoman competitor, a winner of the Titan Games and escaping an abusive relationship.

programme.title: The Rise of Rocky NoHands
programme.desc: S1:E4 How would you feel if you lost in Fortnite to one of the worlds best players, and found out he was using his mouth as a controller? RockyNoHands is a professional eSports Fortnite player, making a career of playing a video game he loves and being among the best in the world at it. After the darkest moment of Rocky’s life left him paralyzed and motionless in a hospital bed, doctors told him he may never walk again. It wasn’t until a source of pure motivation forced him to dig deep to find his unbreakable drive, that he was able to take on his biggest and most rewarding challenge yet.

programme.title: Jennifer Aniston vs. Brangelina
programme.desc: S1:E12 For almost 20 years, the media portrayed Jennifer Aniston as a heartbroken woman who would never be happy until she had kids. That couldn’t be further from the truth. Our team uncovered details that will prove Brad and Jennifer were the perfect Hollywood couple everybody adored, until Brad suddenly left Jen for Angelina Jolie. This story is so much bigger than Brangelina.

programme.title: Rihanna vs. Chris Brown.
programme.desc: S1:E1 Rihanna found herself the victim of assault, from her best friend and then-boyfriend, Chris Brown. Not only was she humiliated in front of the world, but she also faced further attacks from the media, some going as far as claiming the violence was her fault. We uncovered the real story of Rihanna’s experience during and after the incident, not the one portrayed by the media, where she shows us why she is the strong, compassionate, graceful woman the world fell in love within the first place.

programme.title: Drake Bell vs. Josh Peck
programme.desc: S1:E15 Everyone loved Drake & Josh but people don’t know the dark story behind the world’s favorite kids’ show. Josh struggled with his weight and addiction while filming the show. It was always painful for him to be the chubby sidekick to the cool, popular Drake. Then Josh shocked the world when he revealed that he and Drake weren’t even really friends. Drake was furious, sparking a massive backlash against Josh. But no one knew just how dark of a path Drake had gone down.

programme.title: Kim Kardashian & Pete Davidson Vs. Kanye West
programme.desc: S1:E14 The whole world witnessed Kim and Kanyes marriage fall apart. At first it seemed like they were supporting each other through their divorce, but suddenly Kanye started to publicly attack Kim, accusing her of exploiting and kidnapping their children. What happened? Our team did some digging and traced it all back to Kims performance on SNL. Everyone assumes Kanye’s attacks are because of Pete Davidson, but we uncovered the real reason Kanye turned against Kim Kardashian.

programme.title: Justin Bieber Vs. Hailey Bieber
programme.desc: S2:E7 Justin and Hailey Bieber are at the height of their careers. So why do they keep getting sick? Our team uncovers this isn’t the first time one of Justin’s love interests has had a life-threatening illness. It all ties back to one question, did Justin cheat on Selena Gomez with Hailey?

programme.title: Dr. Edith Edgar Dancing with the Devil
programme.desc: Holocaust survivor Edith Eger breaks her silence on her terrifying experience as a teenager at Auschwitz. Learn how she reclaimed her story and found her voice.

programme.title: Liz Murray - Resilience in the Streets
programme.desc: At the age of 15, Liz Murray was abandoned by her drug-addicted parents and living on the streets of New York City. Against all odds, she managed to finish high school and graduate from Harvard. How did she do it?

programme.title: Lessons from a Kidnapping
programme.desc: Elizabeth Smart was kidnapped at 14 years old and was missing for 9 grueling months. Those were the worst months of her life, the details of which were so awful, she refused to share her story for ten years… until something changed. This is her story of survival and strength.

programme.title: Curtis Martin Running Towards Success
programme.desc: Legendary NFL Player Curtis Martin enjoyed great success playing for the New England Patriots and the New York Jets. After retiring, he was inducted to the Pro Football Hall of Fame…. yet he openly admits that he really didn’t want to play football and that he was forced into it. What dark trauma from his childhood almost kept him from realizing his true dream and the greatest opportunity of his life?

programme.title: Misdiagnosed - Every Mother s Worst Nightmare
programme.desc: Victoria felt a pain in her abdomen. Doctor’s said she was faking it and then the unthinkable happened. She began to deteriorate and ended up completely paralyzed. She was a prisoner in her own body, trapped inside capable of hearing everything but incapable of responding. Doctors gave up but her mother never lost hope. That hope kept her alive and her story has captured the nation’s attention.

programme.title: Paul de Gelder Saved by Sharks
programme.desc: In 60 years, no one had been attacked by a shark in Sydney Harbour... Until one day, it happened to Navy diver Paul de Gelder! How did he survive? What drove him to fight for his life?

programme.title: Muggsy Bogues A Giant On The Court
programme.desc: Muggsy Bogues is the shortest man in NBA history at only 5 ft 3. He’s also one of the best basketball players of all time. Coming from a rough neighbourhood where he was shot at by the age of 5, no one believed in him. He was bullied and mocked because of his height, yet today, he’s got some of the best basketball dunks ever seen. Now, everyone wonders: hows that possible? How did he even make it to the NBA? This is Muggsy’s story: a true underdog who had all the odds against him.

programme.title: Mia Kang The Woman That I Am
programme.desc: Overweight as a child, Mia Kang suffered bullying and a far from ideal childhood. Desperate to lose weight and feel good about herself, Mia began starving herself at the young age of 13. She lost a lot of weight very quickly and this launched her into the modeling industry which continued to destroy her self-esteem and health, until a vacation in Thailand, and her discovery of Muay Thai changed her life forever.

programme.title: Chadwick Boseman Live Your Purpose
programme.desc: Chadwick Boseman lived a life of humility and service on and off screen. He didnt let his diagnosis stop him from showing up for those around him and using his platform to elevate black voices. A true hero, he made every day count.

programme.title: Lauren Wasser The Model With Golden Legs
programme.desc: Lauren Wasser was thriving as a young fashion model, but her life quickly took a dramatic turn when she fell victim to Toxic Shock Syndrome. What started as a normal day for Lauren ended with her being found on the bedroom floor just 10 minutes away from losing her life. Luckily, Lauren survived but was tragically forced to lose both her legs. It seemed like her fashion career was over. But instead, the unthinkable happened.

programme.title: The Fear in Their Eyes
